review.reviewBody: The description for these shorts says 2 side zippered pockets.  It only has one on the right side which is great to stash your phone.  There are two zippers on each cheek of your bum.  They are not pockets.  I assume they are for venting but it is not meshed just opens about 6-8" for each bum cheek.  The material is stretchy and breathable.  I love the color.  These shorts are ridiculously long but I think they are designed that way to easily go over your knee pads.  However, the material is soft and breathes well . These run big. They feel a whole size larger than my other mtb shorts.
review.name: Great biking shorts

review.reviewBody: I have a pair of Yeti?s older Enduro shorts and they are my favorite, unfortunately it seems like they have changed their designs. They are now too long hitting well below me knee. I?m 5?5?, so not terribly short, but looking at the 5?9? model in the pictures they even look long on her. The vent zippers are also very strangely positioned, they used to be on the side/thigh area, now they are higher and towards the butt. I don?t really need two large vents showing my butt in a pair mesh liners. Yeti, go back to the old styles, you were my favorite and seemed like the only brand who knew how to make women?s cycling clothes.
review.name: New design is not good

name: Enduro Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have loads of saucony running shoes so bought these for travel.  I hate them. I don’t know why they have a sock like liner that is useless and make the shoes tough to get on.  no support.  They feel really cheap. I also find them about half a size small in the black color. Very glad I bought them super discounted because I’ll be leaving them behind in the hotel.

comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: I immediately returned these. No wonder they’re on sale so much! They feel cheap and unsupportive. My feet roll off the sole. Low quality.

review.reviewBody: Wear 12 hours a day walking at work. About 13 to 15000 steps daily. Fell in love. I have foot problems and these really helped!! The downside...they fall apart real fast! Clumps of the foam are missing and they crack at seams.
review.name: Great when new!

review.reviewBody: Did not work for me. The plastic overlay made my foot feel overly constricted.

Super disappointed

review.reviewBody: I really like this product and have used it many times.
review.name: I love this!

review.reviewBody:
very light and strong. in addition, it is non-sticky and that helps the cleaning process after lunch/dinner.

-i
review.name: very light and strong. in

review.reviewBody: So far so good, haven’t used it too much yet, but so far it’s tough, the lids fit well, and the handles are cleverly designed and the coating is a must. I use a potholder as well. It heats up fast and holds quite a bit for 2-3 people.
review.name: Quality

review.reviewBody: I purchased this pot for this summer's field season and was quite pleased. The surface cooks eggs and other foods well without sticking, making clean-up a breeze. I Also have the smaller solo pot and appreciate that they will ""nest"", decreasing the footprint in your pack when trekking with a partner. A lightweight yet sturdy option for cooking on the trail, or for saving space in the vehicle when car camping.
review.name: A lightweight yet sturdy option for cooking on the trail

review.reviewBody: I'm using the 2.5L right now on the AT and absolutely love it. It takes up a little space but my wisper lite universal, gsi bowl, spoon, lighter, camp towel and dish/laundry soap all fit down into it. I could probably pack a couple more small things into it but it's fine. I really like the function of the handle and the way the lid locks both for storage and for pouring. I have been cooking yellow and coconut rice each day and have not had any burnt flavors. Cleaning it is simple just boil a little more water and wipe it. Although if you want to you could just use cold water and soap or just use a rag and then ring it. I'm taking extra precaution because of bear. Anyway this pot is great!
review.name: Finally a pot that is easy to clean

review.reviewBody: This pot is very well made. I can do everything I want with it when I go camping for a few days. I'm very happy with it.
review.name: Great Birthday Gift.

review.reviewBody: Works great for my wife and Me. We just used it this week backpacking. We were able to place two deep dish plates inside, with one at the bottom facing up and the other facing down. In-between the plates we placed a fuel canister, pocket rocket 2, small soap container and sponge, Ferrell rod and a small dish towel. All contained in one unit.
review.name: MSR ceramic 2.5 liter pot and Deep dish plates

review.reviewBody: Super happy with how easy the ceramic is to clean. The 2.5 L is the perfect size for everything I like to cook. Light and strong! I highly recommend.
review.name: I'd recommend this product

name: Ceramic 2.5L Pot

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Moonlite Reclining Chair online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Moonlite Reclining Chair
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Moonlite Reclining Chair online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Moonlite Reclining Chair
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Moonlite Reclining Chair online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love it, it's very light - light enough for my needs, and seats very comfortably. What more could one ask for? It appears to be very sturdy from using it over a weekend. Looking forward to more adventures with this chair!
review.name: Excellent chair

review.reviewBody:
I bought two of these and keep thinking about buying more.  I use this chair most frequently at dispersed campgrounds where I want to be able to quickly take items in while I'm away from the site. I got a second one because it's so compact and easy to have on hand for friends who don't have as much camping gear.  More often than not, I'm wishing that I had another one or two because people always seem to underestimate how nice it is to bring chairs camping and they co-opt my seat when I get up. Several friends have bought this chair after using my extra one.  The convenience factor really grows on people by the second time we camp together. They want their own to toss in their camping gear bins. You don't have to remember about packing a more luxurious chair that doesn't even fit in the bin and then it taking up more space in the trunk.   It's not the most cushioned chair in the world, but its still a good one to add to the arsenal.  

The points to attach the seat to the frame are very stiff for the first dozen or so uses, but it gets more pliable in time without becoming so pliable that it's concerning.
review.name: I love this little chair

review.reviewBody: I've had this chair for about two years now. Intermittent use throughout but I recently used it leisurely to sit around while deployed where Im getting the bulk of my proper experience with it. I know that at one point during my ownership this product was updated so take everything Im about to say with a grain of salt as some of if not all of the issues may have been corrected. To start things off, the chair is very comfortable in both the reclined and upright position. I occasionally did notice the two rear limbs of the frame digging into my back (and to be fair I have a wide back) but I got around that by slouching into the chair more. Reclining is pretty easy with the toggles and for awhile the seat would maintain the position set. Ive noticed lately though that the sliders have lost their ability to maintain tension and now fully recline the seat. Im not sure if this has to do with me being 10lbs heavier than before but the experience seems to be the same when my lighter coworkers sit in it so I can only chalk it up to overall wear and tear of the slider mechanism. My biggest gripe Ive had with the chair is that the frame has begun to break through where the ball joint meets up with the plastic socket on the corner of the seats. As of writing this the current moonlite has a weight capacity of 300lbs. Im not exactly close to it but I am a stout 235 and 6'1. I dont know if the previous versions had a lower weight limit but I have seen this with one other review. Ultimately I was very happy with this seat and I believe I got my moneys worth out of it, I just hope the issues have been fixed in future iterations.
review.name: Well rounded design but not without flaws

review.reviewBody: I bought this chair for a 14 day backpacking trip. When i say the one thing i looked forward to when getting to camp was this chair…it was the first thing set up! It fit easily in my pack. Was so easy to set up and tear down. Worth the small amount of extra weight by a million! 10/10 love it!
review.name: I’m never camping/backpacking without this!

review.reviewBody: Had mine for about a year and I love this chair! It is small and light which makes it easy to carry on day hikes and to the kids' football and soccer games. It's also comfortable enough to work as a regular camp chair. I also really like that it is simple to put together and the hammock style makes it easy to shift around to get comfortable.
review.name: Great Portable Chair

review.reviewBody: Great purchase.  I've been using it on my patio, living room, lake beach and campsites and so far have no complaints. The feet are large enough to stay stable on sand and it's nice that you can adjust the back with the side straps. Possibly buying a second down the road!
review.name: Super lightweight and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Nice chair but, arthritis making it far too difficult to assemble and repack.
review.name: Sadly returning

review.reviewBody: Great chair but zipper should be a little longer on the stuff sack-
review.name: storage bag

review.reviewBody: This is by far the most comfortable back country chair I have ever had the opportunity to use.  The recline feature is fantastic and really feels good on my back after a long day.   You can't bet the Value for the weight.
review.name: The Best chair,

review.reviewBody:
I have this chair which I got in the antler color. Been really happy with it. I have a competitors chair also in an ultralight. The elite wasn't available when I got mine, but during the summer this rides in the truck as a cookout/campfire chair. I've had it for at least a year and it's a solid chair. You do sit close to the ground but that's the kind of chair this is, I don't have any complaints about that. 

It's sturdy overall and I really like how you can adjust the back lean with the side straps, that's a huge plus that this chair has that others dont. The legs are solid and the chair has been durable overall. You also can get this chair back in the carrying case without too much effort. Actually got 2 of them blue and antler, and the antler one has a little hanging pocket that my phone fits in. The feet have large rubber nubs that help keep you from sinking into the ground, a feature you pay extra for on other chairs, and that you loose(I would know). 

The only negative is, if you're in a puffy sometimes I'll slide to the very edge and need to sit back up to avoid sliding out of my chair. It is a little pricey but nemo makes high quality durable items and stands by them so that helps justify the price.
review.name: Solid chair

name: Moonlite Reclining Chair

hasVariant.name: Airpin Ultralight Stakes - 4-Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Airpin Ultralight Stakes - 4-Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've been using Airpin's for two years now. I love them. They are very strong, light weight and super easy to use. The quick lashing system makes them super fast to get them set. Then they are super easy to undue. I have 12 grandkids. 6 of them, ages 10 through 12, have started backpacking with me. I just bought another new ultralight tent. It comes with really nice ultralight pegs. They are even a little bit lighter that the Airpin's. Even so, I got new Airpin's to go with the new tent. Strong, No brainer gear helps us all have more fun.
review.name: Light weight and super easy to use

review.reviewBody: great light weight option, but still bent easier than I would have hoped.
review.name: Just a little bendy

review.reviewBody: The stakes have stayed out and the design for securing the cord is clever and makes securing the tent quick and easy. Very lite weight.
review.name: One of the better tent stakes I have used

review.reviewBody:
I am replacing all of my tent stakes - with the exception of sand and snow - with the Airpin ultralight stakes. These things are so light, yet sturdy and well designed enough to avoid bending when they're being driven into the ground.

The only downside is that they're a little bit expensive - but they're well worth it!
review.name: So light yet with solid holding power

review.reviewBody: Amazingly light and easy to use. I pounded these into a really hard dirt surface and they did awesome. they held the angle that I put them in at which allowed me to get a very taut rainfly setup.
review.name: Perfect

name: Airpin Ultralight Stakes - 4-Pack

review.reviewBody: Bomber jacket that is great for a resort days but still feel like it is going to be great in the backcountry(no days in this yet). Sizing is on the larger size, but feel like this is perfect given that it is a shell that was designed to be layered underneath. Pockets are big and useful, pit zips are easy to access, hood fits perfectly over a helmet, and lastly, it looks perfect with the matching Baker bibs. Only thing I would change would be the main zipper I wish had a slightly larger pull tab.
review.name: Bomber Jacket

review.reviewBody: Title says it all. Great jacket, but you'll definitely want a size down, maybe two sizes down.
review.name: Great jacket, buy a size smaller

review.reviewBody: My favorite jacket from Flylow. Runs just a little big so I buy a Large. I’m 6.2” 210 and plenty of space to move around and bend down. Love BACKCOUNTRY!! No shipping fees and easy to return items if needed, at no cost to the customer. Best online outdoor store anywhere!
review.name: Flylow Quantum Pro Jacket

review.reviewBody: Excellent produce, was as advertised, but most importantly, BackCounty's customer service as superb
review.name: Great Service

review.reviewBody: I have to say I was skeptical after reading all the negative reviews about the sizing, but I’m 5’11”-175 lbs and the Med fits perfect. Lots of pockets and the fabric seems very breathable and high quality . Can’t wait to test it out in the backcountry this season.
review.name: Excellent!

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this. I get extra 15% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Brilliant!

review.reviewBody: Not as durable as the description. I bought this in February 2023. Had a wear issue with the Baker Bib so I decided to make sure my jacket was good well it’s not it’s beginning to wear through after only 3mos. I thought this would be dang near indestructible according to the description and the price . It’s a great jacket but I expected a lot more.
review.name: It’s nice but…

review.reviewBody:
I've had this jacket for over two years with double winters in North and South America, and it has held up very well. The pockets on this jacket are huge and very useful. The size fits a bit bigger than expected, which I honestly like.
The vents are very comfortable and big, very nice for hiking and hot days. Hood straps also work very well to put the hood over your helmet on those very cold days.
review.name: Reliable Jacket

review.reviewBody:
I wanted one of these for years. I finally pulled the trigger on a 2019 Quantum Pro in ?wave.? I was initially disappointed the color as the images didn?t seem to represent how much of a green undertone there was with the blue... but it grew on me. Now I really like the color.

At first it seemed a bit stiff... but that too grew on me. I like being able to toss a pair of planks on my shoulder without worrying about slicing up my jacket. It?s nice to squeeze through a tight spot in the glade without fixing a ripped sleeve.

However, I can?t get past the size. At 5?9? and 175 I?m a pretty solid ?M? in most things. But this bad boy fits me like a burlap sack. I have a long inseam for my height and a shorter torso. The sleeves hang past my middle finger tips. The waist hem is halfway down to my knees. I wanted a laying piece for sidecountry. But I can?t imagine hiking in this tent. I kinda look like a kid wearing his dad?s jacket (if my dad had much better taste!) A small might have been a better choice. But by the time I was able to make turns in this thing, it was waaaay to late for an exchange/return. In the meantime I made an impulse buy on a Patagonia  Powder Bowl. Its sizing is more consistent with my needs.
review.name: Awesome jacket but not the right fit

review.reviewBody: Still our toughest and best selling shell.
review.name: 2020 Quantum Jacket Video

name: Quantum Pro Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Solid fit, no seams are nice
review.name: Great everyday glove

review.reviewBody: I bought these as a gift for my dad and he loves them! Great for gravel bike riding. Very comfortable, soft and has great cushion!
review.name: Very soft, great cushion

review.reviewBody: Bought the gloves in November. Wore them maybe 5 times. Discovered yesterday that the seam on the right index finger came apart.
review.name: Great Padding, Not so great sewing

review.reviewBody: Good fit (I'm 6' 4" 185 pounds, normal hands?), easy to put on / remove, padding helps with my arthritis pain (doesn't eliminate), low-height "loop and hook" closure works well.
review.name: Nice design

review.reviewBody: Interesting seamless padding, and not very thick which is the way I like it. Despite using the sizing guide and the suggestion that they may run large, my size L was skin tight making it hard to get on. The opening seems lightly stitched where the top meets and I think repeated wearing would tear this given how the thread stretched when I put it on. Given the tight fit, could have used some loops around the fingers to help. Returned.
review.name: Liked the padding, that was about it

review.reviewBody:
This is for my hand anyway...Here are my impressions. 

Right hand got numbness after about an hour, previous gloves this did not happen. 

I could feel the stitches in the fingers, a bit uncomfortable. 

Easy to go on, more difficult to take off, taking me up to 15 seconds or more to get one glove off. 

Runs hot, not much ventilation, hands get sweaty on the backs and fronts.  

Returning these for a different pair of gloves.
review.name: Meh...Could be a bit better

review.reviewBody: Yes, $50 gloves are so First World. But guess where I live? I ride all the time, and these gloves are all I wear when it's not cold. My poor 30 buck gloves are so lonely! Super Comfy, Extra Cushiony, and most of all, GOOD LOOKING! 1000 miles later they still look new. I don't gravel in them though, and that's where I do most of my crashing, so I can't speak to how they hold up in a fall (I'm a wimp, so I gravel full finger mountain.) This is how you are suppose to ride a road bike; you'll feel cheated in your thinner gloves after you ride these once. Surprisingly roomy for Giro - I could have gotten by with an L, but bought XL like I do with most Italian kit. Still love 'em!
review.name: You're Worth the Extra $20

review.reviewBody: The Supernatural glove is excellent.  The new design and padding absorbs road chatter exceptionally well while remaining comfortable in the heat. The glove has an excellent anatomical fit and the integrated padding conforms well to your hand. The padding is just the right thickness and has not packed out despite over 1,000 miles on them..  They have great road feel. I really like the pull tabs on the back of the finger allowing for easy removal. They actually fit "as described" meaning they are not the typical glove where you order up a size.  I wear these in a Large and my measurements are within the sizing guide for Large.   I have the White and it washes well, and despite the miles on them, they look practically new.
review.name: Excellent padding and comfort

review.reviewBody:
These gloves run large in my experience. The padding is generous, and after trying them out I think you sacrifice road feel for comfort, so if you want a racy glove then these are not for you. 

If your bike is making your teeth rattle and you want something that will help with that, then these should improve your comfort on the handlebar. If you already have a gravel bike with plush tires or a bike with a mild suspension (or both) then you can probably get away with something with a bit less cushion. 

One man's opinion, because glove sizing and preference is unique to every rider.
review.name: Sizing issues for me; padding was fine

review.reviewBody: Great for getting them off fast...love the tabies on fingers
review.name: Good Padding and Quick Pull oFF

name: Supernatural Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Good lightweight but warm jacket for my sons. However, I'm very disappointed that the Cuff at the wrists detached within two wears. This was not the case when we previously purchased these.
review.name: Not as good as before....

review.reviewBody: My daughter loves this jacket! It is the perfect weight for chilly days and easy to layer. Love it!
review.name: Great jacket!

review.reviewBody: Lightweight and warm-I just wish there were more color options available!
review.name: Light and warm

review.reviewBody: Excellent fabric, lightweight and keeps you very warm.
review.name: Yes definitely

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my son for the school year, and he loves it! It's so warm and soft, i highly recommend it
review.name: Super soft and warm

review.reviewBody: Great fall jacket for the kids that's in between a light summer jacket and winter coats.
review.name: Great jacket! Would and have bought again.

review.reviewBody: I recently bought this for My Son, and his thoughts of it were really simple. It's very comfortable feels great, especially on the skin, the hoodie does not feel tight and it's snug and it keeps him warm. Very easy to wash and maintain,keep up the great work north face.
review.name: Easy quick wear for autumn!!!

review.reviewBody: Sent as a gift to a young boy in NC. Mom says it's the perfect weight for fall. I sent a size boys 10, which is a little large, but these jacks can be worn bigger by young kids. Mom was extremely pleased.
review.name: Excellent product

review.reviewBody: Great simple jacket for my son. Wish the arms were a bit longer
review.name: Nice simple Fall Jacket-

review.reviewBody: The hooded jackets were perfect sizing for my kids. They are all petite in size... 13 yr size XL, 10 yr M, and 8 yr M. These are not a tight fit. Great quality.
review.name: Great hooded jacket.

name: Glacier Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Kids'

review.reviewBody:
Wouldn't recommend. I ordered this in the beige, and the images on backcountry show it as an 'all beige' bag.  Unfortunately it seems to be beige and black straps.  They did ship me the right bag, but it seems to have been redesigned since the images were taken. Looking at the manufacturers site, their version is now beige and black straps too, so the 'all beige' version I had ordered doesn't seem to exist anymore. 

This page also mentions "We like how the structured base maintains the bag's shape" but the bag I got does not maintain shape at all. Maybe they redesigned it.
review.name: Photos don't match actual item

hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Entrata Tight - No Pad - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I still prefer the tights over bibs system.  I get to use older bibs with a hole or two (instead of just throwing them away), and have a pair of tights for running or as a base layer for really cold days in the stands.
I wouldn't call these deep winter tights, nor are they lightweight, and that's what I was hoping for.  The light brushed lining is sufficient down to about 35 degrees.
Now to the sizing.  As most have expressed, Castelli is off in their sizing (in just about everything). I sized up, knowing they run small.  My legs are a little disproportionately longer to my torso, but the tight legs are still a little longer.  Oddly, yes the waist is smaller than it should be.  As an 'as fit as can be' middle aged cyclist, this thing is better suited to a teenage wet noodle.    It's not restrictive, but you will notice it.  A waist tie would be a better system.
Ankle zippers are clutch and the price is reasonable.
Still, I appreciate that someone still makes a non chamois cycling tight, and unless some company comes out with something else, going to ride with this one. Craft of Sweden usually makes some XC ski tights that could double for cycling.
review.name: Good and bad

review.reviewBody: I have found these excellent. Seem a little on the small size for the marked size but very comfortable once on. I like the high waist and fitting in this area. Able to pull up and fit well in place. No tendency to drop and allow lower back to be exposed and get cold.
review.name: Excellent Cycle Tights

review.reviewBody: I was not sure how to give a star rating. The tights seem well made but run so small I could not get them on. According to the size chart I should have ordered a size medium, knowing Castelli I orderd a large but still too small. I could not get them past my hips.
review.name: Run extremely small

review.reviewBody:
Ridiculously small waist, I could not pull them over my knees!  I have other Castelli shorts and tights in 2XL and they fit fine.  These were laughably way too small in the waist.  Like kids clothing.  Sent them back.   Castelli makes great clothing and It's all I wear for cycling these days.  They really need to get their act together with sizing and standardize it across the board.     I can't imaging how many lost sales and customers they have had because of odd szing.

6 ft tall, 175 lbs, normal build, low body fat, cyclist.
review.name: Castelli Entrata Tight Sizing Problem

name: Entrata Tight - No Pad - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wish it had a powder skirt and came in a petite length
review.name: Okay jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this jacket in preparation for a ski trip in Utah. Skied 5 days in this coat with considerable snow and some winds all 5 days. Extremely happy with this coat and was able to layer up underneath if need be. Extra room in the hood was great for windy chairlift rides. The color is more of a salmon and I received numerous compliments on the jacket.
review.name: Love this coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great jacket! I like to use this jacket as a top shell to protect me from cold winds while I'm outside for hours. I I love the color and have gotten so many compliments. My last jacket was a similar model and I've had it for 16 years so definitely worth it !!
review.name: Great investment

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely loved this jacket, but fit smaller than I expected. I returned it, but intend to re-purchase when I can try it on.
review.name: Great jacket, but measure first, size up if unsure!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great light jacket. I love the colour. I ordered M thinking I would need more space to layer up but ended up being way too big. Returned it and ordered the S. haven't fully tested it yet in cold winters, can't wait to do so. It would have been nice to have a zippered pocket inside. The hood is a bit small if you want to use it for ski, but it is not a 'ski' jacket.
review.name: Great multi functional jacket for winter

name: Summit Chamlang FUTURELIGHT Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Gift for adult son. He likes it! Easy to handle. Fits cupholder in car & beach chair. Easy to clean.
review.name: Get this one!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] No complaints, I've ordered a few of these for myself and family.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Appreciate that you noticed you forgot to engrave the tumbler and allowed me to reorder!!
review.name: Appreciate that you noticed you

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great tumbler, and great addition to my hydroflask collection! I love the color.
review.name: Great tumbler

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my second all-around Tumblr and I absolutely love the size 28 ounce. It’s perfect because it’s not too big like some of the other brands. It holds plenty, and just easier to carry around. I also love the lid and the fact that you can use hot or cold liquids. I ordered the 16 ounce for coffee, love it too!
Oh, and not to mention, the personalization is perfect! It looks great on my cup and the shipping was so fast.
review.name: I love this tumbler!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have several Hydro Flask cups and really like all of them. I use all of them and they work great. I look forward to drinking from my newest one when the weather gets cooler. It will keep my hot drinks from cooling off before I can drink them.
review.name: Another great cup from HydroFlask

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’m extremely happy with my purchase.
I’m a yeti girl, but love the size of the hurdles. I’ve always loved the water bottles and the coffee tumbler is great
review.name: 28 oz tumber

review.reviewBody:
Special order with custom engraving.
The service was very fast. The engraving is perfect. 28oz is a nice size for all cold beverages.
review.name: Good size!

review.reviewBody: i love using this for coffee. i bought the compatible straw too. it’s the perfect size for everything!
review.name: perfect tumbler!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the size, lavender color, and of course, it works great to keep my bevs hot or cold just like you’d expect out of Hydroflask!
review.name: Another great hydroflask

name: 28oz All Around Tumbler

review.name: For the 10k powder days

description: Buy the Black Diamond AirNet Harness - Men's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: AirNet Harness - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond AirNet Harness - Men's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: AirNet Harness - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond AirNet Harness - Men's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I am new to climbing, and my opinion may be off on this harness, but I am firmly convinced that BD is producing quality, excellent products. The materials are light, but durable. Flexible, yet sturdy. I couldnt be happier and excited to hit the walls!
review.name: LIGHTWEIGHT BUT SOLID, OUTSTANDING QUALITY

review.reviewBody: Leg loops folded over under weight immediately. I have the correct size, as the large was too big on me. My legs are on the bigger side but fit in the leg loops well - until I'm hanging in it or belaying.
review.name: Unacceptable leg loops

review.reviewBody: I was pleasantly surprised that this is more comfortable to hang in than my padded harness. Like the other reviews say, it is much more packable and easy to walk in too.
review.name: Better than my padded harness

review.reviewBody:
Don't use their sizing chart. Order maybe 2-3 sizes larger than you need. Im a 32" waist and could barely squeeze into it. After it was on the left hand gear loop was way around my back where your chalk bag would hang. I ordered the Momentum harness I already had and lasted me years.
On the positives, it is very light weight and very small. I wish it would have fit properly.
review.name: Can't even use it

review.reviewBody: I climbed in it twice now, and love it for hard sport climbing when every ounce matters. Very nice and light and you forget it's there.
review.name: Amazingly light, but still comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Used this harness about twice a week (4 hrs a week) for 18 months for indoor climbing. Very lightweight and with reasonable comfort for the cut down design. Good for indoor use ! However you will have to trade durability against low weight as I now need to replace the harness as the tie in points have worn out in that 18 month period. Maybe not unexpected given the nature of the harness but you are paying a premium price for it so bear in mind if you are looking for something that lasts a little longer.
review.name: 18 Month Review

review.reviewBody: Love how light this is. As comfortable as the arcteryx ones I’ve always worn.
review.name: Everything you need, nothing you don’t.

review.reviewBody: The BD Airnet harness is amazingly compact and lightweight. It packs small which is great for travel and long approaches with lots of gear. It's not the most comfortable harness but it's not uncomfortable. My main complaints have to do with the gear loops. The front ones are set too far back to make them convenient to access quickly, and the rear ones being unprotected fabric don't seem very durable so I can't see using this for alpine or long trad routes.
review.name: Super compact and lightweight but not perfect

review.reviewBody:
If you have read reviews on this harness, you will realize that it is a niche harness. The weight savings, compact nature, and standing comfort are amazing compared to the Solution. I often forget I even have it on.

Now for the caveat. It is far less comfortable on the legs and groin when falling, or when taking a fall while belaying. Noticeably so. But in the gym and sport crag days, I think the pros far outweigh the cons.
review.name: Great sport harness with 1 major caveat

review.reviewBody:
This harness is meant for sport climbing and does not have a lot of extras like adjustable leg straps or large gear loops. I find it extremely sleek looking and it fits well. The only reason I did not give it a 10 was it's lack of comfort. You will quickly find that sitting back in this harness for extended periods of time is not a pleasure.

I still highly recommend it for indoor sport climbing.
review.name: Exceptional Harness

name: AirNet Harness - Men's
AirNet Harness - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I ordered the Navy and Erosion Pebble Orange colors and so far I really like these jerseys! I've only just tried them on, but I'm excited to use them as summer jerseys. The fit on the Navy appears to be a bit smaller than the Erosion Pebble Orange, but I really like the style on the Erosion Pebble Orange. It isn't see through, which some other jerseys are guilty of. 

They have sticky material on the back lower seam to reduce riding up your back. Also the sleeves are nice and long, for a more modern stylish fit. 

I might recommend you wear these with bibs that ride a bit higher. My castelli bibs sit beneath my belly button, and the Navy color only just barely covers my bib in the front. 

I ordered a medium for a tighter race fit. I'm relatively tall, so sometimes I run into issues where jerseys aren't long enough. Again the grey color was perfect, and the navy color somehow fit a bit shorter.
review.name: Beautiful jerseys, quality material.

name: Race 2.0 Short-Sleeve Jersey - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had the smaller size of this for things like summer camp, and I wanted the full-size version for travel. Everything fits easily enough, it’s very lightweight and durable, and the overall layout is very easy to use. I don’t know that I will use the mirror, but it’s clever.
review.name: Lightweight and convenient

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Designed intelligently, well constructed. Highly recommended.
review.name: Designed intelligently.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best toiletry bag. I bought a bunch as gifts this year
review.name: Light and strong

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This kit is the lightest one on the market. Don’t think it is too big because with the low profile it lays flat and keeps things visible. It has the right amount of separators so no feature creep going on here. Love how it hangs or lies flat.
review.name: Worth the money!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the material and weight. I have so many bottles, etc that it’s a bit flimsy for the weight I put in it. That being said, if you’re low maintenance with the amount of toiletries you have, it’s perfect.
review.name: Super lightweight

review.reviewBody: I’ve used mine for almost two years while backpacking and for six months overlanding. I like its multi-pocket organization and durability.
review.name: Backpacker and overlander review

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Simple, lightweight, with just enough compartmentalization to keep organized on the go. My only suggestion is that the hanging hook could be a little larger for doorknobs and spaces without an obvious place to hang.
review.name: Simple, lightweight, with just enough

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got a large one and it is really roomy. I can put all my skincare products in one bag. I will use it in my next travel. The bag is lightweight and sturdy! No complaint!
review.name: Large toiletries bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Worried tooth brunch might not fit well in small one, it did!
review.name: Love the weight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent product design, light weight with strong materials. I have taken this bathroom bag on numerous adventures, overseas and motorcycle camping excursions and have had no problems. I like the strong zipper, internal mirror and overall function of the design. I would purchase and replace again if I lost it. Thanks Sea to summit for another good product.
review.name: Bathroom bag

name: Hanging Toiletry Bag - Large

review.reviewBody: Love these - been many years since I've had a pair. I should not have waited so long to come back. Great for hiking, in the water, and around town.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: I wear some type of sandal daily, either Tevas or Birks. Was a little disappointed that after wearing my first pair Tevas for over 25 years, I couldn't find the original design in black leather again like me my first ones. Am very pleased though with the ones I was able to get.
review.name: Still a fan

review.reviewBody: This Teva Original is a classic which I'd buy any time! Love them!
review.name: Great Buy, A Classic

review.reviewBody: I love this color and the platform of this shoe. It's a men but I'm a women. It's perfect. I just ordered a size down.
review.name: Love!!!

review.reviewBody: I will use the sandals as everyday and hiking and day hikes and anything I can think of being outside!! Love how they look I actually love the "honey mustard" color i think it looks very nice on a guy like me!! Can't wait to "break" them in. And wear them to every chance I get.. btw you his is my second pair of tevas both purchased from in the last 3 months! I now know i really love tevas and wish I would've bought them way sooner
review.name: I was so happy when these arrived and very fast they shipped

review.reviewBody: I love the fit and the mid platform is really cute. I would buy these in men's again if I find that my size is not available in women's. Just sized down one size. Perfect fit.
review.name: Great for women with medium to wide feet

review.reviewBody: Wear these EVERY DAY !!!! Bought 3 TEVAS in 2 WEEKS. Took my first TEVAS down the Colorado RV in Grand Canyon --36 years ago--and over Lava Falls--only #10 Rapid in USA.
review.name: GREAT COLOR---LOVE THE EXTRA CUSHIONING

review.reviewBody: Tires roll fast and great puncture resistance. Road 5k + miles with 1 flat, high puncture resistance. Easy setup on zipp wheels. 30mm provide awesome cornering.
review.name: Great riding tires!

review.reviewBody:
Replying to the other review, the 26mm tires should never be pumped up to 100psi and that's probably why they blew off. In contrast, I run 28s and inflate to about 60psi for smooth tarmac and less for broken roads or wet. They are extremely grippy and smooth with tons of control in tight crit corners. They manage to be smooth and supple while still feeling taught. These are some of the best and fastest road tires out there at the moment. They also do great at avoiding punctures. 

Whole heatedly recommend this for serious racers.

They also mount easily enough though not the easiest though you can inflate them with a floor pump and no sealant to get them started.
review.name: Excellent tires!

name: P Zero Race TLR Tire

review.reviewBody: There is a reason these are so cheap. They are warm, I'll give them that. But like other reviewers have said, they are so, so stiff. I'm constantly worried I'm going to lose my poles, because I can't grip anything with these on.
review.name: So stiff

review.reviewBody: Warm, but fingers are stiffer than my skis. Need the grip strength of a silverback gorilla to close my fist. This made it impossible to grip ski poles and other routine tasks.
review.name: Warm rigid gloves.

review.reviewBody: I'm really sorry to report that I'm not happy with the gloves. They are so bulky I can't grip anything like a ski pole. I wore them during a XC skiing outing yesterday and my fingertips were so cold. I'd like to return them if possible.
review.name: Women's Cloud Bank Gore-Tex Glove

review.reviewBody: Amazing shoe. Feels like a part of me. I actually lost 30lbs this year. Thanks to the comfort of these shoes I was able to start running with my tailors bunion. Wish the sole lasted longer. Will order again for sure .
review.name: My first barefoot experience

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable and they fit like a glove. True sizing.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Great replacement for my Vibram FiveFingers. Light and airy, but with just a tad more protection from pesky trail pebbles. I've noticed no difference in terms of gait, which is what I wanted--to still be able to avoid heel-strikes and pounding my knees. Keeps me light!
review.name: Good replacement for Vibram Five Fingers
comment: Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts.

review.reviewBody: While I prefer wide toe box zero drop shoes and was hoping these could work as another pair of trail shoes, these ended up pretty uncomfortable for me when I tried them on.
review.name: Not for me

review.reviewBody: My second pair in a different colour! So comfortable
review.name: Fantastic fit

review.reviewBody: Love these! Just bought my second pair. These are my everyday go to shoes
review.name: Comfy as!

review.reviewBody:
These shoes feel great! I love feeling the floor or ground when I’m working out or walking. Such a great way to stay connected to the planet. Plus, they look so cool with the flame-colored bottom — who could resist? 

The one problem I encountered was the shoelaces were too long and kept coming untied. I tried double-knotting the bows but found a better solution: I tied a knot in the ends of each shoelace to shorten them and pull the bow really tight. Stays tied much better!
review.name: So comfortable! So cool looking!

review.reviewBody: They have finally widened this shoe so now I am finally able to wear this brand again. I love them.
review.name: Great shoes!

review.reviewBody: I thought they would be more like the trail glove. They are not. You feel every little pebble.
review.name: Not like a trail glove

review.reviewBody: Fits perfectly and comfortably.  True to size.  I wear these every day.  After trying out a pair I bought a second in another color because I loved them so much.  I highly recommend these shoes for a minimalist feel.
review.name: Right show for daily wear
comment: Thanks for your feedback and recommendation Tara!

name: Vapor Glove 6 Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I wear Hokas every day for work in a manufacturing environment but I also wear them around the house and for walks around the neighborhood. The Clintons were super comfortable but the foam soles inevitably wore out and I lost grip. The Transport soles are much more robust for my shoe needs while still providing a comfortable shoe when I am on my feet all day
review.name: Convert from Clinton to Transport

review.reviewBody: While I like the style of the shoe and it is comfortable when walking, it does not stretch in the toe box area, causing pinching of the toes. This shoe is not for folks who need a wide shoe.
review.name: Not for a wide foot

review.reviewBody: Great shoe for long walks -- the best cushioning out there.
review.name: Best walking shoe ever

review.reviewBody: I do a lot of walking and the Transport is by far one of the most comfortable walking shoes I have ever owned.
review.name: Great walking shoes.

review.reviewBody: I use these for every day- all day walking. this is my 2nd pair and I will probably buy another one.
review.name: One of the best tennis shoes I've ever worn

review.reviewBody: My feet are so relieved with the fit of these Transports.
review.name: I would buy other colors if they were available

review.reviewBody: I wear this shoe for gym and training and everyday.
review.name: Great everyday shoe

review.reviewBody: The upper is separating from the sole after only a week
review.name: Wouldn't buy again

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes to travel to Europe with. I've put a lot of miles in them already. I didn't have time to formally break them in, but that wasn't much of a problem. The footbed is stiffer than my Clifton's, which is great for walking on the cobblestone streets. They also have a water resistant exterior, also great for rainy days in Europe. I would recommend sizing up half a size from your normal size.
review.name: Great Travel Shoe

review.reviewBody: Ran in Hokas now using the transport as a everyday shoe. The fit is good long term wear is yet to be seen. So far it's been an great shoe.
review.name: Walker

name: Transport Sneaker - Men's

review.reviewBody:
These are good gloves. 
Pros:
The padding on the palm is nice and I dont notice it while wearing them. 
Touchscreen sensitivity seems fine. 
Dont feel overly hot.

Cons:
I wish they had some knuckle protection.
The palm padding is very thin.
review.name: Good Gloves

review.reviewBody: I normally wear gloves with no pad/protection and I opted for these because it had the gel pads, since I lacerated my hand earlier in the season. Fox gloves I always had to size down for some reason or else I end up getting blisters. So far these gloves are good enough for me.
review.name: Decent Gloves

review.reviewBody:
First, I have to say the color I ordered (selected) was not the one that ended up going into the cart. My fault for not double-checking my order so I ended up with teal instead of black...I don't know if it was the site acting up that day or my internet lagging. However, I was pleased with the color. What really was disappointing is that the picture shows much more padding than what you actually get! Really, there isn't much more gel padding than the thickness of the leather. They fit really well and that's the only reason I'm keeping them. 

Certainly not with $30...maybe $10 at best!
review.name: not what I expected...for two reasons

review.reviewBody: This is probably one of the lightest mountain bike shorts out there.   When it is really hot, this is the short.    I also have wild-rye's Freel short, which is great but heavier and good on normal summer days.    I got a size 4 in the Riley, and I have  a size 6 in the Freel.    So this short runs larger than the Freel.     I wear a size 6 in most Wild-Rye apparel, but not in this short.

review.reviewBody: These bags are so small for the price.  I don't know what you could possibly stuff into them.  I should have looked closer at the size and not just the photo.
review.name: overpriced for such tiny bags

review.reviewBody: These are well made and very light. Sure they are small, as advertised. I bough 1 liter and 2.4 liter. They are .46 oz and .67 oz (both below spec) and that's mostly zipper. The dimensions are as stated. I use them as ditty bag in my shelter. I like to have easy access without having to dump everything from a stuff sack. These bags are significantly tapered on the ends that seem a little awkward and space-inefficient at first glance. The zipper fabric is stiff and make the bag seem banana-shaped when empty. In use they work fine. If your counting grams and want a top-zippered ditty you should buy some. Bonus: the packaging is also a zippered bag but with a mesh top.
review.name: It's the shape not the size

review.reviewBody: Good Lightweight bags.  the shape and the zipper is a little funky, but are easily to get use too.  I use them with a number of different sizes to organize my bag.  when you first open it up you will think they are small, they are not.  start stuffing things in and you will see.
review.name: Good bags

name: Air Zippditty Stuffsack - 2 Pack

review.reviewBody: These were easy to install and ride well but after only a short time both front and rear started to leak sealant from the side walls.
review.name: Leaking Side Walls

review.reviewBody: I purchased these tires so I can participate on a few road rides on my gravel bike. I was very pleased with the ride and comfort these tires provided. Additionally, very pleased with the traction especially in wet conditions.
review.name: Great tire for road and slight gravel

review.reviewBody:
These were my first tubeless tire set-up. I've been riding them on my Cervelo R3 for roughly three years now. My rear tire received a gash on a ride which apparently was just a bit too big for the sealant to keep sealed, as every ride after that, sealant would spray out and attempt to re-seal it. It held air pretty well, but I felt it was just time until I would be out on the road stuck removing my nicely sealed valve and putting a tube into a messy, sticky tire. So, I went shopping...

If I had loved these tires, I wouldn't have had to shop very long, as they were on sale and available immediately. But, frankly, as a cost-conscious-road-biker primarily, I don't love them. Compared to my road tires (Gatorskin, Grand Prix 4000s, Grand Prix 4 Season, and Vittoria Rubino Pro), they simply wear-out too fast.

After looking at all the 32c gravel options, I ended up buying these again (I do like how they roll on pavement, how they look on my bike, and the "just right" amount of grip they have on fire roads), along with a slightly knobbier/beefier Panaracer Gravelking+ (just in case I get a gash in the new tire). If the new tire expires too quickly, I'll move on to the Panaracer and hope for greater longevity.

With regard to mounting, the old Re-Fuse tire came off quickly, using a tire lever to help break the seal, and the new tire went on easily, with roughly equivalent effort to getting a typical road tire on. With a shot of air from a compressor (valve core removed), it was seated first try.
review.name: 2nd round - wear fast

review.reviewBody: I bought a set to roll on my gravel bike wheels in the winter on the road. They were recommended from a friend whose opinion I trust and he was right. They roll great, are tough as nails and I felt confident on them on a 45 mph descent. They were a workout to get on but lot's of soapy water and tire levering got them there.
review.name: Works well

review.reviewBody: Just switched over to these a few weeks ago as gravel season approaches, and couldn't be happier. First off, they were SUPER easy to mount for me- I set them up tubeless and they only took about 45 minutes from start to finish (which included pulling off the old tubeless tires, by far the bigger time suck). They went on quick, set the first time (using an AirShot inflator) and held seal immediately. I'm only running 32s but these things are comfy and make easy work of light/medium gravel (plus they are super reasonably priced). I haven't gotten into more serious gnar yet but cant wait to give them a bigger challenge!
review.name: Perfect All-Rounders!

name: Re-Fuse TR Tire

review.reviewBody: I only have one tour of a couple thousand vert and a day of resort skiing. The boots are very light. Fit great out of the box. I have a 106 mm ball of foot and extremely high arch with corresponding high instep. I tweak them a little and only heat molded the liners to create a nice pocket for my ankles. I am a big guy and they held up pushing a 100 mm waisted ski with tech bindings.
review.name: Nice boots

review.reviewBody: Great fit, light, AND good stiffness. Exceeded my expectations.
review.name: Great boot.

review.reviewBody: I have a narrower foot and high arch this was best fit and good toe room.
review.name: Great fit. Snug heal good toe room.

review.reviewBody: 1400g touring boot, nice and stiff compared with the rest of the backland boot line. Excellent at walking uphill. The flex is not very progressive. I am returning the boots because the volume is too much for me (generally average, some pronation, street shoe size 9 mens, 26.5 mondo). The last appears to be slightly wider than the rest of the backlands.
review.name: I wish it were less volume!

name: Backland XTD Carbon 120 Boot - 2025

review.reviewBody:
This is my second pair of these Full-Zip pants. I love them! The first pair lasted for years and years.
Having the full-zip feature works great for pulling these pants on over other pants and boots before you head outside.
review.name: Hooray for Full-Zip Pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great pants. I’m so glad to find full zip rain pants instead of only quarter or half. The full zip are way more practical. Seems to be good material, we’ll see how it holds up in the rain.
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like these rain-proof pants so much that this is my 2nd pair, after using the 1st pair for 10+ yrs. The best feature, other than being waterproof, is that they zip the full length of the pants. SO, easy to get on or off over muddy hiking boots. I bought them a bit large to fit over lightweight hiking pants, but still good over a simple base layer when you're doing strenuous hiking and generating a lot of heat.
review.name: Great rain pants. Excellent full length zippers!

review.reviewBody: I can't say that I don't like these rain pants but I can't say I love them.  They come in short and that is the reason I bought them.  However I wish they were lined, unless I wear something under them they stick to my skin and I don't like that at all.  They just need to be lined.  I do recommend them to anyone need rain gear, just wear leggings under them.  I didn't buy the jacket for the same reason, no lining. There are days when it's just to warm to wear leggings or something else underneath these pants.  They do a great job of keeping you dry.
review.name: Eco pants ( rain gear)
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.
 
We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via  https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been working outside 8 hours a day this summer and have worn these rain pants on the many days of heavy, unrelenting rain we have had this summer in Vermont. They are fairly breathable, comfortable, and definitely repel water for awhile in lighter rain. However, after several hours of constant rain, they do soak through and my legs and undergarments get wet. In contrast, my Gortex Marmot jacket keeps me dry even after an entire day in pouring rain! For this reason, I'm considering upgrading to the Marmot Gortex rain pants.
review.name: Water repellent but not waterproof

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Solid pair of rain gear which is nice to come in short and longs!
review.name: Good Gear!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My ideal rain pants, loosely fitting petite length that allows me to layer for warmth. Easily stores with your Precip jacket in your backpack.
review.name: Favorite travel pants for the Pacific Northwest

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great product and I love the short length!  Thank you to Marmot!
review.name: For short-legged women!

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair now, after wearing almost everyday for 4-5 years outdoors as a teacher in an outdoor based pre-school.  The inside finally wore out.  I was going to try the full zip version this time, but it was sold out in my size.  *** I really appreciate the petite sizing, which is what drew me to these pants in the first place. Some reviewers said they were too short, but at 5'2" that's not a problem for me.  Petite sizing is meant for 5'4" and under, so if you're 5'4" you may want to choose "regular" sizing (whatever that is supposed to mean.  Haha.)
review.name: My second pair.  Love the petite sizing.

review.reviewBody: Super-excited to have pants that aren't too long! Hoping they last, but so far so good- was out 2 hours in solid rain and they lived up to their waterproof rating. Also like Marmot's efforts to use less environmentally damaging materials
review.name: So far so good

name: Precip Eco Full-Zip Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I have size 8 hips and size 6 waist and 5'4". I ordered a size 8 and the rise was too short and the shorts bunched in the crotch. Also, while the fabric was nice & light and good leg length, the waist adjustment was 'chintzy' - a grossgrain ribbon 1/2" wide with small plastic adjusters that were difficult to adjust. And no fastener system for liners.
 I am returning. I have another pair of Patagonia mtb shorts different model in size 8 that fit better and have more robust waist adjustment and liner fasteners.
review.name: Rise too short & no fasteners for liners

review.reviewBody: Coming back to order another pair of these which after many many miles in the saddle are still my favorite pair of mtb shorts I’ve ever owned. Roomy enough to wear a chamois with, but tailored fit. I usually wear a size 6 in regular clothes so I ordered a size six and they fit just right. The fit me a little more slimly than the model in the photo which is what I prefer anyway so I don’t get caught on the seat. Backcountry has a great return policy so I never hesitate to try something. So glad I did!
review.name: Sturdy yet stretchy

description: Buy the Nathan Run Sling 2L Hydration Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Run Sling 2L Hydration Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nathan Run Sling 2L Hydration Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great addition to my Nathan Hydration
review.name: Perfect size

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great access sling bag. Perfect for hiking! I love how I can access stuff in the bag while still moving.
review.name: Easy access bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wear this sling all the time. It holds so much and I get so many compliments on it. I love going on hikes with it and walking the dogs. I would definitely recommend this bag.
review.name: Love this sling

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is now my go-to bag I grab for everything...except running. Haha. In all fairness, I bought it for that purpose! I love the "belt bag" trend but I have always wanted one that was bigger and could hold more items...water included! This bag is just perfect. It has a TON of space - way more that I expected and I think it is so cute!! I also do want to add that I have used the additional waist belt to run in it (had to try it out) and I was shocked at how well it stayed in place.
review.name: Love it - plain and simple!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was very excited to try this sling. However, I found that no matter what, the main strap slid up and chafed my neck. I stopped multiple times to adjust the main and torso straps, until I got so frustrated with it that I changed it to a sort of side Fanny pack—that was the only semi comfy way I could finish my run. I loved the idea of being able to carry water and my phone in this sling, and the sling itself is well made, but my boobs seems to be the issue. All of that being said, it’s a nice Fanny pack or crossbody sling to use for walks, theme parks, or non-strenuous activities.
review.name: Would be great…if I didn’t have boobs

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sling is the perfect size! Great for carrying my phone, keys, headphones, water etc. while running, hiking and walking. It's doesn't feel bulky at all, and the extra torso strap means it doesn't bounce at all when running which is amazing!! It's also stylish enough to wear out and about during the day, so getting a lot of use.
review.name: Perfect size!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I went on a long run with this sling and it did not bounce around AT ALL. It fit my phone, a pair of gloves, neck warmer, gu, airpods case, keys, and still had tons of space left. Even with all of these things I still hardly noticed it was on my body while I was running. And not carrying my handheld water when its 30 degrees out was a huge plus. Excellent, perfect, I'm in love - 100 stars!!!!!!
review.name: A RUNNER'S DREAM

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great hands free solution for hydration while walking and running! Perfect fit and size. Included water flask is very convenient and has great storage space for phone/keys etc. I use it daily and get lots of compliments!
review.name: Great size and function

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so excited about my new sling pack! It is the perfect size to carry everything around in for a days activity, a hike, etc! The water bottle is a great extra bonus! There are multiple compartments within the main zipper and an additional zipper on the outside that is perfect for a phone!
review.name: Great Size, Great Features!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Limitless Sling 2L has great compartments to carry on either long/short runs or walks. Comfortable and adjustable straps that keep it snug to the body without feeling cumbersome. Rolls nicely and packable. Stylish to wear even on runs to grocery store and errands. Waterproof for all weather types.Wipeable material super easy to keep clean. The flask is the perfect size for shorter runs and hikes just enough without being bulky and plenty to stay hydrated on shorter distances. Absolutely love my new pack. Thank you for thinking about all the fabulous features and at the same time look great!!!!!
review.name: Awesome pockets. Light weight. Stylish.

name: Run Sling 2L Hydration Pack

hasVariant.name: Snoskiwoski 40L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Snoskiwoski 40L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Snoskiwoski 40L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Snoskiwoski 40L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Really like the capacity of this bag, also the color makes for finding things on the inside very easy. It’s almost like you just turned on headlamp. I will say, though on terms of access back panel access would be nice other than that very adjustable very comfortable and feels very durable.
review.name: Definitely a good bag, no headlamp needed

review.reviewBody: They seem to be trying to sell last year’s version On their American website to get rid of old stock. The updated 40 L pack is available in Canada already (He has an updated ski carry Shoulder, And comes in a full “state orange” color). Very odd to me that they’re trying to get rid of old stock by passing this off as an updated Version of the same bag. If you look at the 30 L version, you can clearly tell that it is the updated version on their website. I’ve included here photos of the updated version that show clearly the new ski carry system (a vast improvement from the old versions that would always break).
review.name: Great, but website is selling old version.

review.reviewBody: The most dialed backcountry pack I've ever worn! Every loop, buckle and strap makes sense for all of the backcountry tools needed, including a designated spot for an ice axe. I am very short but the S/M even in the 40L version sits on my back well while providing plenty of space for gear, layers and snacks. Super durable around sharp tools like crampons and ice axes!
review.name: Dialed and ready to rip!

review.reviewBody:
The white cordura soaks up water like a sponge, which leads me to almost never use the thing for fear it may precipitate or be placed on wet ground 

The side straps don't fully tighten to compress the pack, so if not loaded up it flaps around 

The top flap is pointless and gets in the way 

It packs "out" rather than "up" so if fully loaded you get pulled backwards

All around needs more R&D from people in the field not the factory 

Source: professional mountain guide
review.name: Soaks up water like a sponge

review.reviewBody: Somewhat disappointed. Had higher hopes. Main reason for purchase was the alleged improved ski carry ability.  Mechanism for diagonal carry on right shoulder was utterly worthless.  Poorly designed and broke after five minutes. Good news is that the pack is incredibly versatile, and I found a way to adapt and overcome. A few minutes of improvisation and tinkering made it work.  It’s not ideal, but seems to be good enough for now. Impressed with side access capability, but top storm flap needs work. In my opinion, it’s facing the wrong direction and is more difficult to secure. Await further testing in the mountains this winter but not sure this is an improvement over the Scrambler 35 which I have already and is a very good pack.  The only saving grace is that I bought at nearly 50% discount.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: Had this bag for like 2 seasons it’s great fits all my avy stuff and stuff for touring

name: Snoskiwoski 40L Backpack

review.itemreviewed: EQUIPE RSR Jersey SUPERLEGER S9 - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I love this jersey.  I have two of them.  This jersey is great for weeknight group rides and hot laps on the MTB trails.  Given the limited (and honestly, not ideal) storage, this jersey is limited to rides where I cary only a gel.  I recently paired this jersey with the Assos GTC Kiespanzer bibs and think that hits a sweet spot for longer gravel rides as these bibs include storage. 

Otherwise, I found the jersey runs small.  I usually wear a medium in the Assos Equipe line but needed a large.
review.name: Ideal for short rides and XC

name: EQUIPE RSR Jersey SUPERLEGER S9 - Men's

review.reviewBody: I really enjoyed these soft, warm slippers my first day at camp.  However, the ground at my 40 degree campsite was not completely dry and the moisture slowly seeped in the bottom of the slippers.  I wasn't able to get them dry for the remainder of my 6 day trip.  These would be great at a cold camp ... assuming the ground is completely dry.  And with the weather here in the pacific northwest, that's not likely. The description doesn't mention a waterproof bottom, but I just assumed that would be a requirement of a 'camp slipper'.  So I won't be using these on my future backcountry hikes.
review.name: Bottoms of the Slippers Absorb Moisture

name: Cush Hybrid Slipper

review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased the Backcountry Destination 7in Lined Shorts, and they are exactly what I was hoping for. The fit is spot on—comfortable without being too tight—and they offer just the right amount of room for movement. They also have a tough, durable feel to them, which makes me confident they will hold up well over time (though only time will tell!). The style is great too, with a design that looks sharp whether I'm out on a hike or just wearing them casually around town.

One detail that stood out to me is the lining. It's slightly looser than what you’d find in Patagonia shorts, but this actually adds to the overall comfort. The lining doesn't bunch or feel restrictive, making these shorts ideal for all-day wear. I’ve already purchased three pairs, and I'm sure I’ll be buying more in a few years once these finally wear out—if they ever do!

If you're looking for a pair of shorts that balances style, comfort, and durability, I highly recommend giving the Backcountry Destination 7in Lined Shorts a try. They’ve quickly become my new go-to shorts for any adventure or casual outing.
review.name: Perfect Fit, Comfort, and Style

review.reviewBody:
Loved last years Pecos River water short, had great hope for these. The crotch (no fly or false fly) is way too high and long. The liner isn’t super rewarding or useful. 5” inseam is decent, but wish they were a little more true to fit. 
Bring back the Pecos, those were a top notch short!
review.name: Not what I’d hoped

review.reviewBody: Great short I wish the crotch on the liner was a little higher to provide better support. Fit is great length is true to size.
review.name: Great short

name: Destination 7in Lined Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: It is so frustrating that I can not get  this watch to connect to my phone dispute doing every single troubleshooting step.
review.name: Will.not.connect to my phone

review.reviewBody: Button doesn’t work in the new one and now I need to wait til they gone fix that.
review.name: Button doesn’t work on the new one
comment: Thank you for your review and experience with the fenix 8 - 47mm AMOLED. We would like to discuss this further over email. If you would please email us at product.support@garmin.com.

review.reviewBody: When the watch face dims, it is 100% unreadable. Sadly, this hasn't been fixed, likely because it will effect the advertised battery life. Whatever the case, there is no one who has been able to read my watch, myself included, without having to bring it right up to your eyes, like someone suffering from blindness. My old Fenix 4, which this one replaced, is easily readable. Garmin, you have 24 days left to fix this or it's getting returned.
review.name: When the watch face dims, the time is unreadable.
comment: Thank you for your review and experience with the fenix 8. We would like to discuss this further over email. If you would please email us at product.support@garmin.com.

review.reviewBody: The watch is buggy even with the latest bugfixes. Haptic feedback doesn't work at some apps, crashed a few times already, the battery shows hours of unmeasured results, youtube music is unavailable. Will wait a week and return the watch if I won't see any progress.
review.name: Full of bugs
comment: Thank you for your review and experience with the fenix 8. We would like to discuss this further over email. If you would please email us at product.support@garmin.com.

review.reviewBody: I just spent 3 hours trying to get this watch set up. Online instructions have not been helpful. Not happy with watch faces - unable to figure out how to change or modify data fields. Cannot sync with Garmin bike radar.
review.name: Challenging set up

name: fenix 8 AMOLED Sport Watch

review.reviewBody: They look cool, are certainly high quality leather. But they just aren’t that warm. I warm them on a 25 degree day and my fingers were cold. Anything above 30 seems to be okay but not toasty.
review.name: Just Not Warm

review.reviewBody:
Got out the tape measure and followed sizing recommendations. I could barely get them
on and had to pay the fedex shipping to return. I'm thinking Backcountry should check to make sure the sizing chart is accurate. Time and money wasted. I'll buy at my local shop in the future.
review.name: Wayyyy too small - Sizing chart is wrong

review.reviewBody: I like the gloves but I needed a larger size than the sizing guide indicated. Back country charged me to return the wrong sized gloves… I’ll buy elsewhere going forward.
review.name: Solid gloves, beware back country

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and well made.  Not ideal for those extreme cold ski days, but a glove liner remedies that.
review.name: Awesome glove!

review.reviewBody:
Agree with these being VERY warm. Honestly, for me, they are too warm. When i bring these touring, I only put them on when things get real cold, otherwise I will end up sweating - and I'm not talking about touring up in them, that's only when I'm at the top or on the ridge.  I wouldn't consider myself having "hot hands" - I usually do okay. 

I think it's notable that if you do find yourself having issues with cold hands, you should probably elect to use mittens.
review.name: Best Gloves, and very warm!

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this. I get extra 25% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Brilliant!

review.reviewBody:
Contrary to other reviews, they ARE warm! It is always VERY subjective on “keeping hands warm” and people blame the gloves. Well, I usually get cold hands due to poor circulation, so I wear mittens. I was extremely skeptical buying these, especially with this price point. A buddy said he’d buy them from me for $15 off original if they didn’t work for me. Well, he bugged me for a long time after because these worked great. 
Just finished skiing a week in Park City where temps dipped near zero with wind chill, and hands were fine. Even on the lift with wind gusts at 35mph that blew the lift to a stop as we got off at the top. Dexterity is great, looks great too.  Love these things almost more than I love my dog. 
Only downside is that after I loaned them to a buddy who forgot his gloves, he packed them out bad - was wearing liner gloves that were too thick and kept jamming his hands in. They’re still ok, but the wool lining is just a bit thinner now. 
Buy them with a discount code and it’s an even better deal.
review.name: Contrary to other reviews, they ARE warm

review.reviewBody: Nicely made glove... that does not keep your hands warm. Really isn't that the point? I have seen these gloves highly rated everywhere and it baffles me. I was in a ski shop in Tahoe with my buddy after having just told him that my Hestras don't keep my hands warm. He was looking at the Hestra display and was approached by a ski shop employee who started singing Hestra's praises. My buddy said "do they keep your hands warm?" and the guy was like "well, no, they're more for like the spring, and if you run hot like most of us do, it's not  problem." What? I run extremely hot, and that has nothing to do with my hands. These won't keep your hands warm in even slightly cool temps never mind single digits.
review.name: Agree with the Not Warm assessment

review.reviewBody: Nice looking gloves but I have used twice in cold weather and my hands were freezing compared to other gloves.
review.name: Not warm

review.reviewBody: I have been using Hestra fall line two winters and so far no complaints. They feel good, keep my hands warm and after two winters still look mint. I would recommend it to skiers.
review.name: Good quality gloves

name: Fall Line Glove
Hestra Fall Line Ski & Snowboard Glove | GH Review
