review.reviewBody: For me this hoody is almost perfect. It is so soft, blocks out wind, fits nicely (doesn't choke around the neck), enough stretch in the hood area that you can put it on without unzipping the collar area. Love the thumb holes, and it feels well made. It is a lot longer than I anticipated, I'm 5'4 and properly worn it almost covers my entire butt. This may be a huge win for some, for me it sometimes makes me feel shorter for some reason. For sizing, I'm usually between S and M due to my curvy hips, but I went with a S and it fits great with room! (140 lbs / size 28 in jeans)
review.name: If you like long hoodies

review.reviewBody: I bought it on sale as a new mid-layer for hikes and long distance walks and am loving it. It's lightweight, warm, more windproof than expected, and very comfy. I love how it's a bit longer in the back. Great under a vest or rain jacket for spring walks.
review.name: Great mid-layer hoodie

review.reviewBody: I originally bought as a midlayer for backcountry camping, but after trying it on I think it will become my midlayer I wear at camp when I'm winding down for the night. Super cozy and feels warm. Haven't been able to test it out at camp yet but seems to block wind more than I was anticipating for a midlayer. Great price on sale. My only qualm is that as soon as I purchased this it went on sale even more, but because I had already placed my order and it had been shipped they wouldn't honour the new price. Other than that I am happy with my purchase.
review.name: Cozy, comfy. What I was looking for

review.reviewBody: We purchased a black one and it had a faulty zipper. We emailed outdoor research and got us a new one very fast. My wife is happy with the sweater. The black wasn't available so we had to choose another color.
review.name: Gift for my wife warrantied

review.reviewBody: My new go-to jacket for everyday use. Washes well and fits true to size.
review.name: Great, everyday jacket!

review.reviewBody: True to size. Very comfortable. Fits nice under a vest.
review.name: Cozy

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable and cozy. Love how it's longer in back covering bum. Nice long sleeves with thumb holes. I sized down as other comments suggested to. My measurements are small but XS fits perfectly.
review.name: Perfect fit!

review.reviewBody: I've had this jacket for almost 2 years now and I'm HEARTBROKEN that it's been discontinued. Please bring it back (especially in the Kalamata color, it matches my scrubs!) as it is a perfect jacket for wearing all day every day at home or at work.
review.name: Wish I'd Bought More!

review.reviewBody: Now that the weather is getting cooler, this hoodie is great around the house or outside under a vest. Walking the dog or on a hike, this hoodie does a great job. It is lightweight, warm and very comfy. My daughter sent me one as a gift and I loved it so much I bought another.
review.name: Great Trail Hoodie

review.reviewBody: Received this item and after wearing it for a day around the house, went to put something in a pocket and it fell to the floor! Turns out the pocket was completely ripped up inside. I tried to exchange it, and was told it was not covered under warranty. Very disappointed with the quality and customer service and will not be returning as a customer.
review.name: Came to me with a completely ripped useless pocket.

name: Trail Mix Fleece Jacket - Women's

description: Buy the Eureka! NoBugZone 3-in-1 Screen online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: NoBugZone 3-in-1 Screen
hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! NoBugZone 3-in-1 Screen online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Pole broke the first day. While I was setting it up, the wind blew and twisted the shelter and snapped the pole before I could stake it out. Pretty disappointed.
review.name: Broke first use
comment: Thank you for posting your review. We are sorry to hear about this wind damage to the pole and request that you contact Customer Service at 800-572-8822 M-F between 8am and 4:30pm EST.

review.reviewBody: From reading the negative reviews, I believe most are user error.  This thing has been great.  We haul it all around Alaska and has stood up to the worst weather without issue.  We are big fans of Eureka products; they truly last and remain dependable year after year.
review.name: Ignore the negative reviews!

review.reviewBody: We are a recently-retired couple (yes, in the late 60's) and have been extremely pleased with our top-quality and well-designed Eukeka! products in the past (e.g. our Bon Echo Tour 600, which we LOVE). So, we did not think twice about buying their NoBugZone 3-in-1.  We should have read the more critical reviews more carefully. For us, it was the wrong choice.  On the positive side, it does keep out the flying bugs and mosquitoes; it provides good shade and is definitely waterproof, but because of the angled wall design, you must buy the optional screen walls to keep the rain from dripping down and blowing in the sides.  However, we are very disappointed in the overall design and function.  This is our first summer using the shelter in in Canadian mosquito country (The Whiteshell, Manitoba, anywhere in Ontario!) and mosquito season (early June).  First, it is extremely difficult to set up. No way one could do it alone. The pole system is a nightmare, both in set-up (very flimsy and difficult to raise) and packing. The pole system is stored in the bag in a very strange and impractical way, once you can get them all aligned properly.  We were also surprised that when set up, the four staked corners -- where the closed zippers meet the ground -- do not fit flush with the ground. There is a significant gap, which was where the wasps and ground squirrels got into the shelter! We thought we might have bought a faulty product, but see in the pictures the same issue, so it's a design flaw. Finally, we bought the shelter mainly as a bug shelter only. Being able to open it up wide makes no sense. If there are no bugs, we'd simply not set it up!  Still, we are going to press on using the product but would not recommend it to anyone. Eureka! can and should do much better than this.
review.name: Eureka! can do much better than this

review.reviewBody: I got this as a Christmas gift and tried it for the first time last week. The support structure kept bending, even with three adults holding everything up while tightening the lines. It’s totally ridiculous! A huge disapointement. Do not buy.
review.name: Terrible product
comment: Thank you for the time out to leave your review. Your feedback is important to us. I am sorry that you are having a hard time with your NoBugZone. We would like the opportunity to speak with you to assist you further on your concerns. Please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday.

review.reviewBody:
I would also like replacement poles for this. I have a completely broken pole. It was our fault and kept it open in a storms. Still it seems like a given that there should be replacement parts. If I can't figure it out, what do I do? Throw the full thing out?

It is also hard to keep the flaps close enough to the ground to keep the bugs out. We have to lay large rocks on the flaps.
review.name: Replacement poles / flaps let in bugs

review.reviewBody: A a little disappointed at first until we learned how to set it up correctly. Now very happy. Shelter packs into a relatively small space and provides excellent protection from sun, rain, wind, cold weather, and probably bugs when set up and guyed out correctly. Will post a full review on my Modern Tent Camping YouTube Channel.
review.name: Great Shelter but Needs Better Set-Up Instructions

review.reviewBody: I have never written a review in my life, but I read them and I wish someone had warned me about buying this shelter.  The support structure of this tent is terrible.  It sways and bends no matter how taut you get your guy lines.  This shelter is perfect during set up in your house or on a beautiful sunny day, but add any sort of wind and it is useless.
review.name: Waste of Money
comment: Thank you for your time is sharing your review. I will be sure to share this with are quality team for review as it is very helpful especially with our newer product line. We would like the opportunity to speak with you to assist you further on your concerns. Please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday as we want you to be able to enjoy your tent.

review.reviewBody:
I was so excited for this tent and spent the extra money assuming this was a good purchase. The tent ripped in two places the first time it was used under normal circumstances. I sent it in and rather than replace the bug netting, they patched one rip and left the other one untouched. I had asked for a replacement of the bug netting since there was a materials failure on first use.

The packing materials are very cheap. The poles are SUPER clunky to pack and to keep organized. Rather than provide a full bag to store the bags, a cheap alternative of end sleeves are included. Hint: The end sleeves never stay on (how could they?) and I'm constantly worried about the metal poles tearing the carrying bag and the tent for that matter which from my experience is easily torn and of poor quality. The poles are so unruly I had to use a set of bungie cords to hold the poles together. There should be a separate bag for the poles, the screen and the shade. Instead they included cheap ties to tie everything with. Seriously, they don't work either!

I tried to add pictures but gave up when this system said the files were too large at 5MB.

On top of this, the tent reeks of flame retardants and I can feel residue on my hands from handling the tent. This has been a very disappointing purchase.
review.name: Cannot recommend this tent
comment: Thank you for the time that it took for you to leave this review. I am sorry to hear of your bad experience with your NoBugZone and appreciate all feed back. If you haven't already, please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday and we would be happy to discuss this further. We want you to be able to enjoy this tent.

review.reviewBody: It got rusted after 3 night no rain camping. Email to  eureka customer support and never heard from them.
review.name: The frame rust after 3 night camping.
comment: Thank you for taking the time to reach out. I sincerely apologize for our delay in response. We would like the opportunity to speak with you to assist you further on your poles. If you have not already, please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday. We want you to be able to enjoy your tent,

review.reviewBody: From our past experience with Eureka we expected this product to be high quality. We were not disappointed.
review.name: High quality as expected!

name: NoBugZone 3-in-1 Screen

review.reviewBody: It's thick, heavy, and doesn't compress well, but this jacket is super warm, significantly more so than any of the 60g synthetic jackets. The big collar does a really good job of sealing in heat and the liner noticeably cuts wind. True to Rab sizing, I'm 6', 180lbs and the large fits perfectly with room for a flannel and maybe vest underneath but not too much where you lose heat. I'm continously impressed with how warm this fleece is, wish it had a good.

review.reviewBody: I carry two in my saddle bag and they take up less room than one butyl tube.  Blow into the stem b4 installing to give it some shape to install without twists or wrinkles.  Lightweight, compact, and great tubes.  Used them when damage to tire was in excess of sealant ability.
review.name: Lightweight, compact, and great

review.reviewBody: I went to pump it up after I installed it and it popped right near the valve close to the seam where the plastic was thin.  I want my money back.
review.name: Garbage

review.reviewBody: I have used vittoria and ridenow TPU tubes. These seem to be more difficult to install and don’t retain air at all. Put a pair on my bike. One held air for 24 hours the other went flat in 3 days. Bad product. Vittoria and ridenow are great and ridenow is very reasonably priced!!
review.name: Much better options

review.reviewBody: Hmm, Guess I should have read better.  The MTB S-Tubo apparently have removable stems, the "road" version clearly states it does not on the "tech details".  I missed that, I run 404's that require a valve extender.  I did actually unscrew the valve stem and use a extender, but I'm 100% I voided any warranty etc. in doing so.  MY BAD.  Having said that, I blew air in with my mouth, mounted everything and it was "easy", no problems.  They seem to actually hold air better than my previous lightweight racing butyl tubes, so that's a positive.  I haven't had a puncture, but that was never an issue for me, so I'm not a good judge of puncture protection.  I'm not supposed to mount to "rim brakes" and ride hills, but per my infrared thermometer and testing, I haven't demonstrated any temperatures of concern for myself.  I certainly cannot endorse, nor recommend, but I'm simply stating, I measured mine in my local area with a infrared thermometer after riding hills.  I wasn't concerned with the data my thermometer provided to me, so I'll continue using.  They are soft and the ride is nice in conti'5000's on zipp 404's with a standard carbon road bike.   Happy riding, may your PR's seem easy and your chamois comfortable.
review.name: S-Tubo Road tube 42mm valve, pair review

name: S-Tubo Road Tube

review.reviewBody:
It is a new product, but there were many scratches due to movement and friction inside the box.
It doesn't feel like I bought a new one.
The beacon should have been packed in a plastic bag or something and then in the box.

Also,
I put in a new battery that I had after opening it, but it didn't turn on.
There was a problem with the battery contacts, and I solved it by slightly stretching the spring.
However, I thought it was not a fundamental solution,
but a recall was announced.
I want a refund.

review.reviewBody: I’m a 5ft 120lb woman who fits in the xs sweatpants for men better than the sweatpants for women because the inseam is 28in in the men’s version. These sweatpants don’t lose the brushed fleece when washed and are durable yet soft. Im usually a size small in women’s clothes so I’m guessing these pants run true to size for men but would guess they are kind of short inseam for anyone over 5’5” if you want full length. These sweatpants are a tighter fit than generic sweatpants but still not a skinny snug fit.
review.name: Warm and not baggy

review.reviewBody: The sweatpants were super soft and well made, but incredibly short. They hit my husband mid calf and he doesn't usually have any issues. I would suggest that the sizes be looked at again to make sure that they are consistent with other men's athletic clothes.
review.name: Sweatpants

review.reviewBody: I bought these pants a couple months ago and they both felt and looked great! However, within 5 wears the zipper broke completely, making the pants unwearable. They don't appear to be sturdy enough to last.
review.name: Great...at first

review.reviewBody: I loved these pants so much, they fit great and I love the purple pocket. They're light which is nice for summer hikes. But sadly the zipper broke. I'd only worn them a few times and it broke from just putting them on normally. I hope they figure out how to make these more durable so I can get another pair.
review.name: Loved them but they broke

review.reviewBody: I like how these fit, drape, that they don’t seem to pill or attract lint. They wash and line dry without wrinkles. I cut off the tab things on the bottom of the legs. The reason they’re not perfect for hiking is the pockets need to be deeper and secure (with zippers or flaps) for phone, wallet, etc.
review.name: Pockets aren’t deep enough for phone

review.reviewBody: These are so comfy and fit perfectly. I wore them all the time since I bought them a month ago. However, the zipper broke which is super disappointing, all I did was wash them.
review.name: Broken zipper

review.reviewBody: I adore the color of these pants and the purple pocket. They're generally comfortable but are in sore need of an elastic waistband--the waist has no give and I have a long torso, so they tend to ride down and flatten out at the crotch area in an unflattering way, if that makes sense. To go with the long torso, I have very short legs and cuff these pants without cinching the bottoms. It looks a bit messy but works.
review.name: Wish they had a better waistband

review.reviewBody:
I loved the fit of these pants but I expected them to be the same length as my other Wasatch pants and they’re almost 2” shorter (and my pair are already too short for me). They’re a slight looser fit in the legs than the standard wasatch but same waist. 

They’re very cool but definitely aren’t for tall girls.
review.name: Way too short

name: Wasatch Ripstop Cargo Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Great shoe, especially given this one of their first models (young company). Shoe fits small, maybe 1/2 size to full size small, depending on your preference. I wear 11.5 in HOKA and most shoes, and I bought 11.5's before the general feedback about sizing was available. Hindsight, a pair of size 12's might have been better, but after 20-30 miles they broke in nicely.

Pros: Incredible stability, grip, and general traction in extremely technical terrain.

Cons: Tongue could be longer and back heel cup stitching is a little abrasive.

Overall 4 stars because this is a new relatively new shoe and its hard to nail it on the first go. Expecting to get 600+ miles
review.name: Almost Perfect after 200 miles

review.reviewBody:
I’m less than 100 miles in, but these shoes have been great so far. The toe box is wide without being sloppy, the vibram midsole/outsole combination provides a responsive, grippy ride while still allowing for a decent amount of trail feel given the stack height. No foot fatigue on longer runs. 

The upper has been good so far as well. I have several packs and miscellaneous items for traveling that are made out of dyneema and I have used them for over 12 years with zero failures, so the dyneema upper that Norda uses caught my attention. So far, so good. 

They do require some break in, but it was worth the time and effort. I haven’t run in anything but these since I got them. The price is high, so obviously I’m hoping to get the advertised mileage and longevity from them, but no regrets so far. 

I did have to size up by a half a size.
review.name: Unique and amazing shoe!

review.reviewBody: The best fitting, most supportive, longest lasting shoes I’ve ever run in! I’ve put more than 1,000 miles on more than one pair. The uppers are in perfect condition with zero failures. I’ve never had a shoe that has felt like it’s actually a part of my foot. No slipping no sliding around no blisters. I couldn’t recommend the, any more!
review.name: Last Forever

review.reviewBody: Let me first start this review off by saying I never received the product. But I will review the accuracy of backcountry since I did order my size and it was out of stock, but did not alert me and went through the whole process of purchasing something that was clearly out of stock. I received an email stating this after the fact, a few days later, I called up customer service to resolve the issue, which between ordering through Klarna and dealing with the return process, which was much more complicated than I would’ve thought. I’m pretty disappointed to say the least. Not sure how the inventory thing got screwed up but I would’ve gotten these shoes for a discount of 30% off. They made no attempt to give me 30% off one of the other color ways which was not marked at that price so all around a big epic fail. I won’t leave a review of the shoes here because I ended up paying for them somewhere else at full price.
review.name: Failed- stock was incorrect
comment: Hi, I have reached out to you about this situation. I hope to hear from you soon!

review.reviewBody: So far these Nordas have been awesome! I’ve raced them in Western NC and have put about 300 miles in one pair. They still feel like new and the tread looks great! These are perfect for those longer run/hike days and feel pretty quick when needing to pick it up on race day. Last run I did had a 5 mile downhill on packed gravel. These shoes allowed me to cruise down with no issues. Like Norda suggests, I bought a half size up and they fit great. Usually an 11, bought an 11.5. I also just went with my euro size, which remained the same in the shoe. If I had to have one annoying thing, it would be the pull tab on the heel. Sometimes little rocks or dirt gets into the shoe there and gets trapped under the foot. But I like these so much that I just ordered the 002 model for some faster, shorter runs. Excited for those!
review.name: Still going strong!

review.reviewBody:
I’m a trail runner always in search of “the shoe”. Needless to say, I have a closet full of various road and trail shoes.  My favorite brands are Salomon and On and I prefer a snugger shoe.  I don’t require nor do I like a plush Hoka ride.  Due to an injury early in 2023 and 6 months off of running I thought I’d branch out and hook up a new pair of kicks to get me back into running form.  Given the outstanding reviews (aside from the price) I decided to grab a pair of Norda 002.  I loved them! The reviews and comments on the 001 were maybe even better than the 002 (except for the heel lock down) so given my happiness with the 002 and a sale I splurged and hooked up a pair.  Well, I love them more than the 002!!!  Let me give you my take on the “Bond shoes” after about 10 runs in each (trail, road, races).

1.  The 002 is lighter and has slightly less drop and is probably a better race shoe and good for short to mid distance runs.
2.  The 002 has a thinner yet cushioned sole and thus you feel a little more under foot.  I feel little to nothing under foot in the 001 and they are a really smooth ride.
3.  There is more room in the toe box of the 002 than the 001.  I have the same size in both and the 002 feels has less room up front and feels smaller.
4.  Again, the 001 is roomier but not wide (I’m kind of a mid sized width foot).
5.  Size up!  If you have some shoes that are 11 in a brand and some 11.5 in the same brand go with the 11.5 in the Norda!  When in doubt size up!. (Maybe even consider a FULL size in the 002).
6.  The heel lockdown.  If the shoe is the correct size it is not an issue and I get a really good (90-95%) lockdown.  However, my right foot is a half size smaller and I get about an 80-85% lockdown even with additional lacing, etc.  Thicker trail socks help.  Speaking of socks…difficult to wear a thick trail sock in the 002 size for size.  It can be done but its snugggg!
7.  Both shoes are great in mud, wet roads, pavement, rocks, dirt or whatever and the wider outsole is very stable.
8. 001 is a more cushioned ride but still feels pretty light and durable and would be a great shoe to go long in.
9.  Both look awesome!  My wife just about sleeps in them (she has a Lilac 001 pair).
10.  I love the feel of the upper and I don’t know if its waterproof but it holds water out quite well.

I really like my Salomon S/lab Ultra 3 and On Cloudultra but I’m a Norda fan now.   The reports are that they may last twice as long as many other shoes which would make them a good value.  They are expensive, so look for markdowns and sales and make sure you size up.  Both 00 make for a great running experience.
review.name: 00 Comparison

review.reviewBody: I was super excited about these. The promise of durability, along with the comfort and design sold me. However, after only two months of light/casual wear, they have begun to break down. It’s almost unbelievable for the price tag on these things. Very disappointing. I’ve attached photos.
review.name: Seemed Promising but Failed

review.reviewBody:
Super excited to give these a spin. Being one of the few shoes on the market that has a Vibram midsole along with a fully Dyneema upper. After the 300-mile mark on rough and rocky east coast trails, I can confidently say these are taking a beating and have no sign of slowing down. Little to no wear on the sole, upper, or toe cap. Zero compression after long days on the feet and they grip like no other, One of the few shoes that I've recently tried that I can put my full confidence in when cooking downhill. 

Sizing is a bit tricky. I am a size 12 in almost all other brands ( Hoka, Salomon, Saucony, Altra ect ) and these fit but only with very thin socks. Any trail-based thickness socks like darn tough create sizing issues. I would most likely bump up a half size next time to prevent this issue, but they are still comfortable. The only other downside is the lack of draining in these. With a Dyneema upper, they don't breathe super well and have zero drain ports on the side of the shoes. Would and will buy again.

##BackcountryGearhead
review.name: 300 mile review

review.reviewBody:
This shoe is so beautiful looking that it belongs on a fashion runway!

The length of the shoe was spot-on for me. The description says it runs short so I purchased a 12.5 and it was ideal but as a point of reference, I also wear a 12.5 in Nike, Adidas and Hoka's whereas I am always a 12 in Salomon. So, is the short short or the same as other popular brands?
The shoe has some volume but pulling the laces gave a snug yet comfortable fit. It was a very good fit overall except the ankle collar.
It is very wide around with thin material; it is comfortable but despite using the heel-lock lacing method, I could not get a seal and there was always a gap - a perfect place for trail debris to enter. I do have thin ankles so this situation is likely specific to this. 

I have used other shoes with Vibram megagrip litebase and they wore fairly well; I question  if these soles will last about the same. The upper will probably last forever,
review.name: It's a Beautiful Looking Shoe

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, durable and very solid under foot on technical terrain.
review.name: Excellent on technical trail

name: 001 Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is my third pair in this style Wonderful at beach so easy to clean Also slide on and off as slippers.
review.name: Easy Slide

review.reviewBody: I bought the Universal slides in black after enjoying a pair in camel leather. I have worn several styles of Tevas, always finding them comfortable. My favorites now are the slides. I would love to buy another pair of each.
review.name: I love the universal slides!

review.reviewBody: These sandals are exactly what I needed! I have a small foot, short toes and a slightly wider than usual foot and it is impossible to find shoes that are small enough and wide enough for comfort. I wanted a slide sandal but my feet get too hot in typical slides, or they are too bulky. Not with these! I also love that these are not a platform sole. These check all the boxes! Adjustable fit, stay on my feet, easy to put on, comfortable and cuter than ever! These will be my go to sandals for life! Please don't stop making these or change a thing about them! Perfection!
review.name: New favorite sandal!

review.reviewBody: I've had my slides for years now and wear them often. I would buy mire if they ever offer more colors! A while back they had an odd green color that just would not go w anything so I sent them back. Now the only other option is the weird color combo where each strap is a different color. Yeesh. Please please pleeeaaase offer the slides in more colors! Judging by the same sentiment in many other reviews, I'm not the only one who would happily buy more! :)
review.name: I love my black Teva slides...

review.reviewBody: Great fit, great comfort, great quality. My new faves but my old faves were also Texas!
review.name: My new faves

review.reviewBody: I love these so much! I have them in black and wear them with everything! So easy to slide on and off and very comfortable. Please make them in more colors!!
review.name: More Colors Please!!

review.reviewBody: Love this slip on sandal. So comfortable and feels secure on feet.
review.name: I would buy this sandal again

review.reviewBody: I tried these as soon as I got them and they fit great! I've owned multiple pairs of Hurricanes but this is my first without the back strap. I've put them up but look forward to breaking them out next Spring and wearing them daily!
review.name: Excited

review.reviewBody: Hard to keep on your feet, straps by the pinky toe are not comfortable like the straps are on the regular sandals with the back straps. Shoes when walking sound like you are walking with wet sandals even though they are not wet or sweaty. I will stick to the regular style.
review.name: Would not buy again

review.reviewBody: I use these around the house. They are waterproof, easy to slip on and off, and much more comfortable than your average flip-flops. My original flip-flops were slippery, lacked support, and were not waterproof. I have no complaints about these, and I love the color. I usually wear a size 5 1/2. I thought the size 6 would be too big. Turns out the size 6 is not much bigger than the 5 1/2. According to the Teva sizing information and chart, which can be found at the link below, the sizing worked out perfectly. I'm glad I gave these a try. www.teva.com/help-center.html?a=Sizing-Information---id--v0Gb4wyWRxONTthbCPf9Yg
review.name: Nice, Comfortable & Easy

name: Universal Slide Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: I run with large water bottles and they fit good and tight. Now they don’t hit my top tube. Glad I bought them.
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: So far they haven’t ejected my 24oz water bottles. That said, the bottles (one insulated, one regular) don’t seat completely into the holder. It appears they’re being squeezed out of place. But the bottles have remained in place over relatively bumpy/washboarded gravel roads. Accessing the bottles is more top-side than side which takes a bit of practice and not great if you’re bike is equipped with a top-tube frame bag. Aesthetically, they’re a bit clunky looking.
review.name: Ok, so far

review.reviewBody:
l love this particular water bottle cage.  Aesthetically it's a nice design.  It's light weight, and holds your water bottle in place.  Size 21, 24, and 26 Oz water bottles all fit perfectly.    
I have it on my FS mountain bike.  Liked it so much that I bought it again for my Carbon XC bike.
review.name: Perfect Fit

review.reviewBody: I love these holders! I put them on all my bikes, and got rid of all others. They easily fit my contigo mugs, water bottles, speaker, and it's easier to access my 20 oz, very tall contigo. They also don't scratch the paint on my mugs like the metal holders did. Love these. I'm sure you can spend more for a better cage, but you can also spend less for a crappy one- this hits a good price point for a great product. I don't know why more bike shops don't carry these. Glad I stumbled on them a few years ago. Just bought more for a new bike. My go to cage.
review.name: I swapped all out for these.

name: Flow SL Cage Pair

review.itemreviewed: Mountaineering OTC Extra Cushion Sock - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have tried many Darn Tough OTC socks.  This is the first pair that actually stays up.  Tried both the Mountaineering and Tactical  OTC socks and these are nice, thick and stay up.
review.name: These stay up

review.itemreviewed: Mountaineering OTC Extra Cushion Sock - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I originally bought these socks with the intent of using them for back country skiing and mountaineering, but because of how nice these socks are I've been wearing them almost every day.  They performed very well at 35 degrees while crosscounty skiing, flexed well, kept my feet warm but not toasting, and the best part, No smell whatsoever.  I've worn these without washing them almost consistently for about 6 days without smell (gross, I know).  

About the only complaint I could come up with is the fit of these socks.  I'm about a 8.5 men's and ordered medium which says it covers feet sized 8 to 9.5 .  There's a noticable amount of extra sock at the end.  I can normally pull the sock up a little higher but then the heel part doesn't sit quite right.  It also occasionally slides down my shins but these are very picky things and I normally don't notice these things much throughout the day.  If you think you may be bothered by this then I'd maybe recommend you buy a size down if you are like me at the middle to lower range of your suggested size.

All in all this is a great sock and I will be wearing these a lot.  I can't comment on durability yet since it has only been a week since I got them but considering they have a lifetime no questions asked warray, I'm not too concerned.  I will update this review after I really get some use into these.
review.name: Great sock for all your needs

review.itemreviewed: Mountaineering OTC Extra Cushion Sock - Men's
review.reviewBody: My second pair of Darn Tough OTC Mountaineering socks and the quality has declined dramatically. The first pair has a much thicker foot sole which is entirely red. These are red on the toe and heel and are so thin that it affects boot sizing. My first pair weighs 175 grams after many washings. The new pair weighs only 160 grams after the first wash.
review.name: Declining quality

name: Mountaineering OTC Extra Cushion Sock - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Love everything EXCEPT the arms are super long! After one wash and carefully following the washing instructions, the coat has faded visibly on the seams. :( 
It's lightweight for running errands but warm enough in Canadian weather to walk your dog in.
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody:
So glad I have this coat. I live in SE Tennessee so winters are more mild than my original home in the Midwest, but the fit allows me to layer so I'm confident even during my travels this jacket is a one stop shop. 
I bought a large. I'm 5'2", 34J and usually wear a M/L top, size 12. The large fits perfectly, again, with enough room to layer a sweatshirt or sweater underneath comfortably. It doesn't look too big without the extra layer under it either. My ONLY super slight complaint is that the sleeves are way too long (which is a common complaint for me). If they were an inch shorter it would be completely perfect, but I think the cut of the coat is such that they're meant to be longer anyway. It's a specific thing for us shorter folks and it's not anything to make or break the jacket for me personally. I went out of my way to pay full price for it just to get the color I wanted (it was on sale at a wholeseller but didn't have the Acorn color in stock any more), which isn't something I do often. I've had similar coats that cost less but didn't fit as well, and the versatility, adaptability adjustability, potential longevity of this jacket makes it worth every penny.
review.name: Perfect for layering/warmer winters

review.reviewBody: Wonderful parka that was great for colder New England weather. The sleeves were a bit long when I was wearing a large, but after weight loss, elected to buy a smaller size as I liked the winter proof so much. Did great in winter weather.
review.name: Great New England winter parka

review.reviewBody: Scotland in April. Perfect coat every kind of weather. Never been happier w a purchase.
review.name: Always warm and dry

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket in Nov 2023 for my work travel (mostly Seattle). It has become the perfect travel gear for both cold and rain over this winter season. What I enjoy most is - the length of the coat, the two additional pockets in the front (one outside front left and one inside front right) and the adjustable waist in the back. It will keep you warm, which I need, and has also kept my dry during a 20 minute walk in the rain without issue. I did size up in order to give myself additional room for layering, which was simply a preference. I’m now interested in purchasing  a lighter packable style (as similar as possible) to replace my current rain jacket.
review.name: My favorite travel jacket

review.reviewBody: I’m 5’10 and the sleeves are a little short on me. Also the material is pretty stiff. Doesn’t siit down next to your body and makes that shuffling noise when you walk.

A lot of Monday for a coat with pockets that have cheap, CHEAP zippers. I have spent easily $2000.00 on 4 jackets and the zippers are horrible. I would say the coats are great but the zippers make me want to return every coat I have purchased.
review.name: Cheap Zippers that Break Easily

review.reviewBody: Bought this coat for my wife over two years ago and she loves the light weight and warmth she gets from wearing this coat - she says she will never wear a different brand
review.name: Great coat !!

review.reviewBody: I bought my second one yesterday. The first one lasted about 3 years. I was wearing it frequently. I like the snug fit and it is suitable for my activity levels. This is not a winter jacket. It is not very warm. It is more like an everyday jacket for moderate climates. I do like the canvas material but the one thing I did not like is that it very quickly wore down and even after 1 year it looked like I had it forever. But still, very decent.
review.name: My favourite everyday jacket

review.reviewBody: I *love* this jacket. It’s water resistant, warm but not too hot, has great zippered pockets, and looks so cute. But the zipper is horrible. Idk if I just got a dud, but the dual zipper mechanism for some reason makes it impossible to zipper easily. I need to manually line up the two zippers and fit it in at the perfect angle for it to work. Super frustrating for an expensive jacket.
review.name: Awesome but the zipper needs work

name: Kiruna Padded Parka - Women's

review.reviewBody: I actually love the Gore c7 shorts, so expected to really like these. Tried them on and they were very comfortable, extra room in the waist. But was honestly surprised when I turned around to look at the rear. Could completely see everything. Won't go into too much detail, but I returned them. Can't speak about the chamois because I didn't ride with it. But I only recommend these if you've got zero lumps or bumps on your thighs, and aren't too shy about exposure while riding.
review.name: Disappointed. Material is TOO THIN.

review.reviewBody:
I have given these as a gift twice and both recipients love it.  I know it is true because i cycle with them all the time.  Our typical ride is 30 mi and 2000 ft.
  I know other reviews say the product is thin, but we have not found it thin.  The fabric seems high quality and certainly is not see-through.
review.name: High Quality, comfortable

name: C3 3/4 Tights+ - Women's

description: Buy the Fjallraven High Coast Hip Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: High Coast Hip Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven High Coast Hip Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This very well made pack will be perfect for carrying the things I need at hand when I work at an Elephant orphanage in Botswana. I wanted something small,  relatively flat and easy to open with one hand. I think this will be perfect.
review.name: Just what I Need

review.reviewBody: Ok good quality, size is much smaller than what it looks like on the web page.
review.name: Sizing

review.reviewBody: overall it’s a good little bag for just the essentials.  i think it would benefit from having a wider strap, for comfort, and maybe to help it from slipping around so much.  it doesn’t really stay in place, even cinched close to the body.  would like to see that improved.  oh, wearing it as a sling across the body, not as a belt bag.
review.name: wider strap needed

review.reviewBody:
I would keep this bag in a heartbeat if one thing were changed: the loose end of the strap needs to be attached to a tri-glide buckle rather than left hanging loose.  There is a flimsy piece of elastic to secure it, but even when trying on the bag, the strap fell out of the elastic any time I turned the bag onto my back or around to my front. 

For the price, I’m just not willing to constantly be fussing with an annoying dangling strap. Otherwise it’d be a great bag.
review.name: One very annoying flaw

review.reviewBody: I love this hip pack! It holds way more than you may think for a small bum bag. I bought it for my son for a trip to Japan. He is 6’2 and 200lbs. Many hip bags wouldn’t fit him crossbody style. This fit great. When he got back i took it over and use it so much. I love that it is very comfortable to wear around the waist. It stays in place so well, even when filled. The only thing I wish it had was a pass through for the waist straps to stow. That way you could use the bag as a tech pouch too.
review.name: Small but holds a lot! Love

review.reviewBody: Perfect size to fit all the essentials… glasses, keys, wallet and lip balm.
review.name: Everyday bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this for dog walking however yesterday I wore it to a Mud Run. I had put my items in plastic baggies inside thinking they would be soaked. Let me tell you…that pack was submerged in mud water consistently for two hours. I got out and opened my pack and not one drop of water got in which I don’t even know how that can be…it has zippers….not one drop. So if you are looking for an amazing hip pack to use on obstacle courses/runs or even swimming…this is it. Also for dog walking it has two side loops - the loops fit a Chuckit holder. Like this is my favourite pack ever purchased.
review.name: Great for Mud Runs/Dog Walking

review.reviewBody: My daughter is using it as her new PFAS-free high school (and beyond) backpack.  She loves it!!  Our only complaint is for my younger daughter, who wishes there were more shades of red/ purple/ blue because she has to choose a different color from her sister’s, but like the wine colored pack the best.  The different compartments are wonderful and useful, and the build is sturdy and solid.
review.name: My daughter loves her new school pack!

review.reviewBody:
This is a functional bag and I have gotten some use out of it, but it started looking dingy after only a few months. 
Careful washing as directed has not improved the appearance. 
I try to buy quality products that will not have to be replaced every year. 
This bag is not very sustainable and I can't recommend it.
review.name: Light colored material cannot be cleaned

review.reviewBody: I love the 3 zipper compartments. Allows me to organize well in a small bag. Perfect size for the essentials. Holds my phone,  keys, charging stick, lip gloss, band-aides, and a few odds and ends along the way. I do wish the strap was wider from a looks perspectives but it functions fine. Definitely recommend if looking for a small fanny pack of chest bag (I wear as a chest bag).
review.name: Love this bag!

name: High Coast Hip Pack
High Coast Hip Pack

review.itemreviewed: Lightweight All-Wear Hemp 8 in Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Patagonia shorts that have faded and discolored in 3 months.  washed in cold water and hang dry.   the worst looking shorts from color fading and discoloring.   I do NOT recommend these shorts to anyone.
review.name: 8 in hemp shorts forge gray

review.itemreviewed: Lightweight All-Wear Hemp 8 in Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Worn these for months now and while they are very comfortable & light they are too unstructured and just won’t stay wrinkle-free. Ironed them once, still not that great. Not really into pressing my shorts (who is?) but I still wear them…around the house and unfortunately not to work like I’d planned. And yes, they do run a whole size small.
review.name: nice but wrinkle-prone

review.itemreviewed: Lightweight All-Wear Hemp 8 in Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable fabric but these run small in the waist. I had to size up to one larger size than I normally wear.
review.name: Nice shorts, size up

review.itemreviewed: Lightweight All-Wear Hemp 8 in Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am a 34 waist for everything and that typically affords me a little extra room. These run small. The overall quality and fabric was great and the length and leg fit were fine. Had to return.
review.name: Runs small

review.itemreviewed: Lightweight All-Wear Hemp 8 in Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: My husband is very happy with these shorts because they're not too baggy or wide in the leg. He was going for a slimmer profile, so they're perfect!
review.name: Great fit, not too baggy

review.reviewBody:
The sizing was a whole size off, and that's the reason for a star off. I'm a Large sized shirt, and I originally purchased a Large in this product. The fitment was no larger than a Medium, so sizing up to XL fixed the problem. 

This fleece pairs up nicely under a puffer for layering as it's not too bulky. By itself, it holds more heat than originally expected. The hand pockets are quite large in volume, and they can fit 2 Nalgene water bottles per side. On the bottom hem there is adjustment for both the front and the back to retain heat.
review.name: Great thin fleece

name: Ultrafleece Hooded Jacket

review.reviewBody: These are the best boots. I live at 8,000 feet in Utah and have to do a good amount of snow removal in the winter. I was looking for a boot to replace my Boggs and found these. They are awesome! Super lightweight, warm, and the tread is better than I was expecting. I got the tall version because we get a lot of snow. I love the cinch at the top that acts as a gaiter. The only negative thing I have to say is these boots are bulky. Sometimes they are hard to drive in and feel clumsy to walk in. I would recommend the shorter version if you live somewhere there's not a ton of snow. I am debating getting the shorter version for when I go into town and need to walk more. I am anywhere between a 8.5-9 in W's shoes and my bike shoes are a 40. I got the 41, since I am usually wearing wool socks and wanted some room. They work, but I might get the 40 next time. I also got the pink and the color is great. Makes me smile every time I put them on!
review.name: Great winter boots!

name: Niseko 3.0 Boot
